name.namePart: Printed by Joe Funk in Los Angeles, CA.

mods.abstract: The subject depicted is a creature who seems content and protected behind a shelter of cross bars.
mods.note: The three colors used are dark purple, greenish- yellow and a white overprinting. The initial drawing made by the artist was done using a lithographic pencil. Scraping was used to create white lines throughout the composition. The creature, which is doglike in appearance, is claimed by the artist to be a figment of her own imagination. It is neither dog nor fox but is definitely a wild creature which has taken refuge from man and nature behind the shelter provided.

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). Museum of Art
